result.execSummary:
The defendant Randal M. Herrick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randal M. Herrick Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randal M. Herrick Jr. was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Randal M. Herrick Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Judgment for unpaid Restitution; Re: 

Charge: Battery

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Herrick to 2 years in the Wisconsin Prison System, consisting of 1 year 6 months of Initial Confinement and 6 months of Extended Supervision; this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution to Nicholas Leroy in the amount of $7,500
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--Per Standing Order Defendant to pay 5% restitution surcharge

The Clerk clarifies with the Court that Mr. Herrick owes Mr. Leroy $27,156.68 is restitution; Mr. Herrick is obligated to pay the $7500 during Extended Supervision, the remainder is to be converted to a Civil Judgment against Randal Herrick in favor of Mr. Leroy

Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--Per Standing Order Defendant to reimburse Jefferson County Court appointed Attorney fees total owed on this case at the time of sentencing $1,391.50.

11/20/15: Per Standing Order Defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for court appointed Attorney fee in the amount of $791.00
--to pay officer overtime in the amount of $119.28

--All other conditions of Extended Supervision are at the discretion of the Agent

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Conflict Review Worksheet

Cases 15CF267 and 14CF219 called together at 1:50pm [mo]
Defendant Randal M. Herrick Jr. in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF267(Status Conference occurs):
Atty. Laitsch indicates that this case is part of the sentencing of Case 14CF219

As to Case 14CF219(Sentencing & Restitution Hearing occurs):
On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CF267
The Court and Counsel discuss allowing victim of Dismissed Counts to address the Court; the Court recites Case Law, The Court concludes that it will allow victim Becky KM to address the Court
Victim, Becky KM--makes a statement to the Court

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Shock 
--ADA Shock submits State's Exh. #1(Chart of Mr. Herrick's Prior Convictions)--offered and received

The Court does not order Mr Herrick to reimburse Anthem Blue Cross as part of this Criminal case
The Court finds that Mr. Leroy is entitled to $27,156.68 in restitution from Mr. Herrick 

recess:2:29pm--reconvene: 4:07pm[to allow the Court to call remainder of afternoon calendar]

The Court notes that it did review the Victim Impact Statements submitted by Becky KM and Mr. Leroy
Statements made by Ms. Lupkus and Ms. Bowes on behalf of Mr. Herrick 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Laitsch 
Statement made by Mr. Herrick 

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Herrick to 2 years in the Wisconsin Prison System, consisting of 1 year 6 months of Initial Confinement and 6 months of Extended Supervision; this sentence is to begin FORTHWITH

On Count #4 the Court sentences Mr. Herrick to 2 years in the Wisconsin Prison System consisting of 1 year of Initial Confinement and 1 year of Extended Supervision, this sentence is to be served consecutive to Count #1.

As to Count #1:
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
As to Count #4: 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court finds that Mr. Herrick's ability to pay towards restitution over the course of extended supervision is $7,500

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #4: to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay officer overtime in the amount of $119.28
--to pay restitution to Nicholas Leroy in the amount of $7,500
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--All other conditions of Extended Supervision are at the discretion of the Agent


As to Both Counts: Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant


recess: 5:20pm 

[[Post-Hearing//Off-Record: The Clerk clarifies with the Court that Mr. Herrick owes Mr. Leroy $27,156.68 is restitution; Mr. Herrick is obligated to pay the $7500 during Extended Supervision, the remainder is to be converted to a Civil Judgement against Randal Herrick in favor of Mr. Leroy]]

Cases #13CF419, #13CF465,#14CF61,#14CF131,#14CF219 called at 10:10am. [MK] 
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered in Case #13CF465; factual basis stipulated including as to the prior Possession of THC conviction; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Teuber submits the victim impact statement in case #13CF419) ; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Herrick guilty in Case #13CF465, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On agreement of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF61, and the Court dismisses case #13CF419 outright. 

In Case #13CF465 the Court sentences Mr. Herrick to:
--serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on December 26, 2014 at 7:00pm
, consecutive to any sentences in being 
--0 days credit for time already served given
 (counsel are  to submit a written stipulation on days credit by January 2nd) 
--Mr. Herrick is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to comply with DNA sample provision upons request 
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518, plus $25 drug testing fee, plus $33 summons fee in this case and plus $33 summons fee in read-in case #14CF61, plus court-appointed attorney fees; this total amount is to be paid through application of the $2500 cash bail [which currently also applies to pending cases].
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
As to Case #13CF365, the Court continues the bond and its conditions until the jail term commences.

The Court and counsel discuss scheduling in Cases #14CF131 and #14CF219. The Court intends to re-call case #14CF219 at the scheduling hearing time of 11:00am.
recess 10:36am.
reconvene at 11:06am. as to Case #14CF219 only:  ADA Teuber and Attorney Laitsch appear (Mr. Herrick's appearance at this time has been excused).
Counsel confirm that the case is not resolved. 
ADA Teuber recommends that a two day trial length be scheduled. 
The Court indicates that it will schedule the trial sixty days out so that the parties have ample time to prepare and subpoena witnesses. 
recess 11:08am. 

NEXT:  
--in Case #14CF131:  (1) Plea/Sentencing on 12/3/14 at 8:00am (2) Jury Trial remains on the calendar for 12/4-12/5/14 at 8:30am. 
--in Case #14CF219: the case is referred to Branch III for scheduling of FSSC and a two-day Jury Trial in approximately sixty days

Case called at 2:24 pm
Defendant Randal M. Herrick in court with Attorney Thomas J. Laitsch. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court and defendant discuss the Court's appointment of Attorney Laitsch on this case.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Court requires a $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of any alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No contact direct or indirect with Nicholas Leroy or BKM (DOB: 9/29/1971)
-No acts or threats of violence
-Booking by 4:30 pm on 8/6/14
- Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 8/11/14 at 1:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties.
Court will set a PTC on all of defendant's files and then set all files for Preliminary Hearing.
Court informs the Defendant that he should go apply for SPD right away.
